rules: Rule1: Either the production has footage of animal behavior or it has footage of financial analysis.
Rule2: Either the production violates financial disclosure regulations or it does not violate environmental protection regulations.
Rule3: The production is approved by a network executive or it is approved by a regulatory body.
Rule4: Provided that the production is approved by a regulatory body, it does not violate safety standards regulations.
Rule5: Either the production is reviewed by a legal team or it is reviewed by an ethics committee.
Rule6: In case the production is reviewed by an ethics committee, then if it is approved by a network executive, it does not violate safety standards regulations.
Rule7: Should the production complete preproduction, then if it is reviewed by a legal team, then whenever it is approved by a network executive, it does not violate safety standards regulations.
Rule8: The production completing preproduction is a consequence of it securing funding from a corporate sponsor.
Rule9: The production secures funding from a corporate sponsor or it secures funding from a government grant.
Rule10: Securing funding from a government grant implies that the production has completed preproduction.
Rule11: The production being ready for filming follows from it having footage of financial analysis.
Rule12: The production having a conflict with the creative director is necessary if it resolved the scheduling conflict issue.
Rule13: The production resolves the scheduling conflict issue or it resolves the budget allocation issue.

Rule14: If the production resolves the budget allocation issue, then provided that it requires a camera rig, then whenever it does not have footage of natural phenomenon, it has footage of furniture design.
Rule15: If the production obtains clearance for archive footage, then obtaining clearance for music rights ensures that it does not violate environmental protection regulations.
Rule16: Either the production requires a reshoot of animal sequences or it obtains clearance for archive footage.
Rule17: Completing a risk assessment by the production leads to it implementing safety protocols.
Rule18: The production implementing safety protocols means that if it passes the equipment safety inspection, then it does not violate safety standards regulations.
Rule19: If the production has footage of natural phenomenon, then having footage of animal behavior implies it is ready for filming.
Rule20: The production requiring a camera rig implies it requires a lighting system.

Rule21: In case the production has a permit for the filming location, then if it requires a lighting system, then whenever it does not have footage of natural phenomenon, it has footage of furniture design.
Rule22: Either the production has a permit for the filming location or it has a permit for animal interaction.

Rule23: The production having a permit for animal interaction entails that if it requires a lighting system, then provided that it does not have footage of natural phenomenon, it has footage of furniture design.
Rule24: The production not being ready for filming implies that it violates safety standards regulations.
Rule25: The production not being ready for filming leads to it violating environmental protection regulations.
facts: Fact1: The production obtained clearance for music rights.
Fact2: The production passed the equipment safety inspection.
Fact3: The production completed a risk assessment.
Fact4: The production requires a camera rig.
Fact5: It is not the case that the production violates financial disclosure regulations.
Fact6: It is not the case that the production has a conflict with the creative director.
Fact7: It is not the case that the production requires a reshoot of animal sequences.
Fact8: It is not the case that the production has footage of furniture design.

question: The production is ready for filming.
